question: You are writing a Python program that processes a large dataset. During the processing, some data affect the flow of your program because they contain invalid information and your code raises exceptions. You want to effectively manage these exceptions without stopping the execution of your program. Which approach would you take to handle these exceptions?

choices.choice: Wrap the code that could potentially raise exceptions within the try block. Assign each type of exception to a specific except block. This will allow your program to continue execution even if it encounters an exception.
Implement the code without using try and except block and stop the program when it encounters an exception.
Ignore any possible exceptions and hope your program does not encounter any errors during execution.
